item.title: Event finished
item.dc:creator: @WowILikeToCode WowILikeToCode
item.description:
@WowILikeToCode wrote:

rip4d:

I was duoing with my friend. He barraged Graador and we both used Dreadnips on him. They stunned and attacked him, so we had no problem maging him. I wasn’t always taking hits, but when I took melee hits I could tank them for a while in Ganodermic, getting hit for maybe 355 at the highest, and the rest of the hits I took were under 200 if I ever took them; most hits were blocked.

uhm,??? Hmm?? Lie moar?

Read full topic

item.title: Event finished
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

rip4d:

I was duoing with my friend. He barraged Graador and we both used Dreadnips on him. They stunned and attacked him, so we had no problem maging him. I wasn’t always taking hits, but when I took melee hits I could tank them for a while in Ganodermic, getting hit for maybe 355 at the highest, and the rest of the hits I took were under 200 if I ever took them; most hits were blocked.

That is the most weird thing I’ve ever heard… See when you pray melee? You get hit like a 200 to like 400 once every like 10 hits… Also you never mentioned you maged so graahdor couldn’t move. Barraging at bandos is one of the worst idea’s though as the low def bonus against a boss, theres a reason why at most bosses nobody mages lol.

Read full topic

item.title: Event finished
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

I know what you mean, but the range is ranged based. That’s why for medium leveled players they are recommended to wear a full melee outfit if there not tanking :o.
'Graardor often hits very high with his Melee attacks so the Protect from Melee prayer is a must. His second attack is a Ranged attack. When he uses this attack, he slams both fists on the ground and a shock-wave hits the player, inflicting up to 355 damage if the player is not using Protect from Ranged. ’
Source http://runescape.wikia.com/wiki/General_Graardor/Strategies
Its pretty well known his second attack is range, graahdor has nothing to do with mage in his attacks. Even the Gfx + anim looks ranged :P.

Read full topic

item.title: Event finished
item.dc:creator: @Aff Aff
item.description:
@Aff wrote:

[quote=“Kidpaparoach, post:21, topic:429225”][quote author=Aff link=topic=531912.msg3887529#msg3887529 date=1326576114]

Gano has near no range def, guess what bandos secondary attack is? Ranged. Gano is pretty useless here unless your gonna full gano and not tank and pray range?

Also fruit bat etc removes need for brews if your in a 5+ team if you have ss too ofc.

i’m unsure if my sources are correct, but i heard the range attack was mage based? if someone could verify that, i’d be grateful
[/quote]
Your misinformed, I can assure you the ranged is ranged based as from personal experience range protection prayers block it out. Feel free to look it up.
The reason for Karil body etc is because of the mage lt I think, as from personal experience yet again the mage hits a lot on you if your in a melee outfit and the minions tend to hit whoever does the most dmg to graahdor.[/quote]

nono, i think you misunderstand me; the range attack at bandos is similar to bloodvelds. at bloodvelds, the melee damage taken is revolved around your mage defence, similar to what i hear happens at bandos? i’ve always worn k top + tassets at bandos though, so i’ve never really noticed

Read full topic

item.title: Event finished
item.dc:creator: @Aff Aff
item.description:
@Aff wrote:

rip4d:

Amulet of Glory/Ring of Wealth both have teleportation options. Just because its not the first immediate recommendation, doesn’t mean it can’t be used. Don’t forget about the home teleport either.

ring of wealth has no use in ls/cs, so i don’t even see why that’d be an option
amulet of glory isn’t going to protect you when you have 20hp and you’re about to die; that’s why a one-click teleport is best

Read full topic

item.title: Event finished
item.dc:creator: @Aff Aff
item.description:
@Aff wrote:

WowILikeToCode:

dude, where did i say to bring a super set, i didnt. I am well aware of how it works, and rwt? umad? just because i can have a legitly good account dont get jelly bro

i’m selling my maxed main because it’s boring - i’m working on a turm pure now, thanks

anyway, so you’re telling people without ovls to go without any form of stat boosts? and you’re still saying that ovls will work without a super restore? gl w/that

edit: ps gl with bandos with no tele/hammer/pouches/scrolls

item.title: Event finished
item.dc:creator: @Aff Aff
item.description:
@Aff wrote:

[quote=“WowILikeToCode, post:11, topic:429225”]READ WHAT IT SAYS UNDERNEATH THE PICTURE,

I ONLY HAVE 1 RESTORE TO BOOST SUMM POINTS TO RENEW TORT/SUMMON TITAN[/quote]

jesus christ you’re retarded

you just said that brews will defeat the purpose of ovls without super restores, and now you’re saying that you don’t need super restores are only used for summon points?

have fun with your rwt’d account mr badass

edit: super restores don’t counteract the effect of a brew for super pots; your stats drop below your normal stats, super brews bring them back to your normal stats. go try it. you’d have to take another sip of your supers for your stats to go back up
edit2: if you think you’re such a smartass, why don’t you just take a sip of your ovl, drink 5 brews and look at your stats

Read full topic
